answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can find a list of free language courses and activities in Romania on this website page.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Besides language courses, activities such as art therapy, music lessons, yoga, stretching, history classes, chess, drawing, social and legal consultations, educational, developmental, creative, and sports activities, and psychological support are offered.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: IOM offers Romanian language courses for adults.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian courses for adults from IOM'.

answers.answer: One can register for IOM Romanian courses at one of their offices in Bucharest, located at Viitorului Street, no 11, Sector 2, or Constantin Daniel Street, no 5, Sector 1.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian courses for adults from IOM'.

answers.answer: IOM offices are open for registration from Monday to Friday, from 9:00 to 17:00.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian courses for adults from IOM'.

answers.answer: Centrul de Tineret FNT provides Romanian and English language courses, art therapy, music lessons, yoga, stretching, and history classes.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities from Centrul de Tineret FNT'.

answers.answer: Centrul de Tineret FNT serves people aged 14 to 35.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities from Centrul de Tineret FNT'.

answers.answer: One can find the Centrul de Tineret FNT class schedule on their official Facebook page.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities from Centrul de Tineret FNT'.

answers.answer: JRS Romania organizes Romanian language courses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities for adults from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: One can learn more about JRS Romania activities by checking their Facebook group for the schedule in their city.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities for adults from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: JRS Romania classes run from Monday to Friday.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Courses and activities for adults from JRS Romania'.

answers.answer: The Ukrainian Educational Center offers children educational, developmental, creative, and sports activities, as well as psychological support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Ukrainian Educational Center from the Romanian-Finnish Highschool'.

answers.answer: Children from families in or near Bucharest with temporary protection status are allowed to enroll in the Ukrainian Educational Center programs, and they can contact Olga Gireada at +40 726 646 733.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Ukrainian Educational Center from the Romanian-Finnish Highschool'.

answers.answer: The Ukrainian Educational Center operates from 08:00 to 13:00.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Ukrainian Educational Center from the Romanian-Finnish Highschool'.

answers.answer: The Romanian Phrase Book's purpose is to provide common Romanian expressions translated into English and Ukrainian.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian Phrase Book'.

answers.answer: One can access the "Heroes cry too" coloring book by downloading it from the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Coloring book for children "Heroes cry too"'.

answers.answer: The TVR1 Romanian video course is for beginners and is available on YouTube.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian video language course from TVR1'.

answers.answer: The UNHCR Romanian language manual can be used to learn the Romanian language on one's own or with a teacher.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Manual "Romanian language for Ukrainians" UNHCR Romania'.

answers.answer: Terre des hommes language handbooks include a series of guides and work exercises to help Ukrainians learn Romanian on their own.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the section under 'Romanian Language handbooks for Ukrainian teenagers and children'.
